title: Putin Warns NATO, US On Ukraine Using Long-Range Weapons To Strike Russia
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that the West letting Kyiv use longer-range weapons to strike Russian targets would mean NATO would be "at war" with Russia.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that the West letting Kyiv use longer-range weapons to strike Russian targets would mean NATO would be "at war" with Russia.

title: Harris Leads Over Trump, Voters See Her As Debate Winner In Latest Polls
content: Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris leads Republican Donald Trump 47% to 42% in the race to win the Nov. 5 presidential election, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Thursday.
summary: Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris leads Republican Donald Trump 47% to 42% in the race to win the Nov. 5 presidential election, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Thursday.

title: How Gorillas And Traditional Healers May Inspire Breakthroughs in Medicine
content: Wild great apes often consume medicinal plants that can treat their ailments. The same plants are often used by local people in traditional medicine.
summary: Wild great apes often consume medicinal plants that can treat their ailments. The same plants are often used by local people in traditional medicine.

title: Harvey Weinstein To Stand In Court On Rape Charges Again
content: Prosecutors are preparing to retry Harvey Weinstein on rape charges after a previous conviction against the former Hollywood producer was overturned.
summary: Prosecutors are preparing to retry Harvey Weinstein on rape charges after a previous conviction against the former Hollywood producer was overturned.

title: NASA Shares Stunning Pics Of Red Spider Nebula, Leaves Internet Awestruck
content: Located approximately 3,000 light-years away in the constellation Sagittarius, this planetary nebula is home to one of the most scorching stars in the universe.
summary: Located approximately 3,000 light-years away in the constellation Sagittarius, this planetary nebula is home to one of the most scorching stars in the universe.

title: Millions At Risk Of 'Silent Killer', A Condition That Causes Sudden Death
content: Atrial fibrillation (A-Fib) is a serious condition with a wide range of potentially life-threatening complications.

title: Russian Strike Kills 3 Red Cross Workers In Ukraine, Says Zelensky
content: A Russian strike on Red Cross vehicles in eastern Ukraine killed three people, the country's president Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday.
summary: A Russian strike on Red Cross vehicles in eastern Ukraine killed three people, the country's president Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday.

title: British Policing Minister's Bag Stolen At A Police Conference
content: The UK's police and crime minister Dame Diana Johnson had her purse stolen at an annual conference for senior police officers.
summary: The UK's police and crime minister Dame Diana Johnson had her purse stolen at an annual conference for senior police officers.

title: Harvey Weinstein Hit With New Criminal Charges In New York
content: Harvey Weinstein has been hit with new criminal charges in New York, a prosecutor said in court on Thursday, as the Manhattan district attorney's office prepares to retry the former movie mogul following the reversal of his rape conviction.
summary: Harvey Weinstein has been hit with new criminal charges in New York, a prosecutor said in court on Thursday, as the Manhattan district attorney's office prepares to retry the former movie mogul following the reversal of his rape conviction.

title: Lockdowns Accelerated Brain Ageing In Teen Girls More Than Boys: Study
content: Recent research reveals that Covid-19 lockdowns have led to premature brain ageing in adolescents, with girls showing more significant changes than boys.
summary: Recent research reveals that Covid-19 lockdowns have led to premature brain ageing in adolescents, with girls showing more significant changes than boys.

title: Ajit Doval, Reportedly Carrying Ukraine Peace Plan, Meets Vladimir Putin
content: National Security Adviser Ajit Doval has met Russian President Vladimir Putin today on the sidelines of the BRICS National Security Advisers' meeting. The two were seen exchanging a handshake in pictures shared on X by the Russian Embassy in India.
summary: National Security Adviser Ajit Doval has met Russian President Vladimir Putin today on the sidelines of the BRICS National Security Advisers' meeting. The two were seen exchanging a handshake in pictures shared on X by the Russian Embassy in India.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Statue Draws Mixed Reactions, Compared To Market Shopper
content: A new statue of Queen Elizabeth II has met mixed reviews, with one non-plussed critic assessing that it looks more like "an old lady buying potatoes at the market" than Britain's longest-reigning monarch.
summary: A new statue of Queen Elizabeth II has met mixed reviews, with one non-plussed critic assessing that it looks more like "an old lady buying potatoes at the market" than Britain's longest-reigning monarch.

title: Climate Change Drives Surge In 'Coolcation' Trends - What You Need To Know
content: As global warming intensifies, the new travel trend "coolcation" emerges, reflecting a shift towards cooler destinations. With extreme heat impacting southern Europe, northern and central countries are becoming more attractive to tourists.
summary: As global warming intensifies, the new travel trend "coolcation" emerges, reflecting a shift towards cooler destinations. With extreme heat impacting southern Europe, northern and central countries are becoming more attractive to tourists.

title: Opinion: Trump-Harris Debate: It's About Entertainment, Stupid

title: 45 Indians Inducted Into Russian Army Discharged, Efforts On To Rescue 50 More
content: Forty five Indians who were illegally made to join the Russian army and fight for them in the battle fronts against Ukraine have been rescued from the war zone and discharged from the Russian military, the Ministry of External Affairs said today.
summary: Forty five Indians who were illegally made to join the Russian army and fight for them in the battle fronts against Ukraine have been rescued from the war zone and discharged from the Russian military, the Ministry of External Affairs said today.

title: China's Wuhan Lab Creates Vaccine For 'Future Pandemics': "Universal...''

title: Disengagement 75% Complete: S Jaishankar On "Progress" Along LAC With China
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said today that there has been "some progress" with China on the boundary issue. The minister said that approximately 75 per cent of the "disengagement" problems have been resolved.
